title: Average Adult Male Height: Normal Distribution Calculations
question_text:
According to the CDC (Centers for Disease Control and Prevention), the average height for a male age 20 and older is $69.3\text{ inches}$.
Assuming these heights are normally distributed, what proportion of men in this age range have a height that puts them somewhere between $1.2$ standard deviations below the mean and $1.8$ standard deviations above the mean?
